AudioStreamEngine.h

00001 /*
00002 * ==============================================================================
00003 *  Name        : AudioStreamEngine.h
00004 *  Part of     : AudioStream
00005 *  Created     : April 28, 2006 by Forum Nokia
00006 *  Description : Declares the Engine class for AudioStream application
00007 *  Version     : 2.0

00015 
00016 #ifndef AUDIOSTREAMENGINE_H
00017 #define AUDIOSTREAMENGINE_H
00018 
00019 // INCLUDES
00020 #include <e32base.h>
00021 #include <aknviewappui.h> 
00022 
00023 #include <mda\common\audio.h>
00024 #include <MdaAudioInputStream.h>        // audio input stream
00025 #include <MdaAudioOutputStream.h>       // audio output stream
00026 
00027 #include "AudioStream.hrh"
00028 #include "AudioStreamView.h"    
00029 #include "AudioStreamAppUi.h"   
00030 
00031 // FORWARD DECLARATIONS
00032 class CAudioStreamView;
00033 
00034 // CLASS DECLARATION
00035 
00036 /**
00037 *  CAudioStreamEngine application engine class.
00038 *  
00039 */
00040 class CAudioStreamEngine : public CBase, MMdaAudioInputStreamCallback, 
00041         MMdaAudioOutputStreamCallback
00042 {
00043 public:
00044 /*!
00045  * NewL()
00046  * 
00047  * discussion Create new CAudioStreamEngine object
00048  * return a pointer to the created instance of CAudioStreamEngine
00049  */
00050     static CAudioStreamEngine* NewL(CAudioStreamAppUi* /* aAppUi */);
00051 
00052 /*!
00053  * NewLC()
00054  * 
00055  * discussion Create new CAudioStreamEngine object
00056  * return a pointer to the created instance of CAudioStreamEngine which 
00057  *    has also been pushed to cleanup stack
00058  */
00059     static CAudioStreamEngine* NewLC(CAudioStreamAppUi* /* aAppUi */);
00060 
00061 
00062 /*!
00063  * ~CAudioStreamEngine()
00064  *
00065  * discussion Destroy the object and release all memory objects
00066  */
00067         ~CAudioStreamEngine();
00068         
00069 
00070 public: // New functions
00071         
00072 /*!
00073  * Play()
00074  *
00075  * discussion Plays the audio data sample
00076  */
00077         void Play();
00078 /*!
00079  * Record()
00080  *
00081  * discussion Records an audio data sample
00082  */
00083         void Record();
00084 /*!
00085  * Stop()
00086  *
00087  * discussion Stops the playing/recording of the audio data
00088  */
00089         void Stop();
00090         
00091 /*!
00092  * LoadAudioFileL()
00093  *
00094  * discussion Loads an audio data from a file
00095  */
00096         void LoadAudioFileL();
00097 /*!
00098  * SaveAudioFileL()
00099  *
00100  * discussion Saves the audio data into a file
00101  */
00102         void SaveAudioFileL();
00103 
00104 /*!
00105  * SetEncodingL()
00106  *
00107  * discussion Sets the audio encoding to be used
00108  * param aAmr If ETrue, AMR-NB encoding will be used, if EFalse, the platform's
00109  * default encoding will be used
00110  */
00111         void SetEncodingL(TBool aAmr);
00112         
00113 private: // in-class methods
00114 
00115 /*!
00116  * GetFrame()
00117  *
00118  * discussion Returns a modifiable pointer to a single frame inside the
00119  * audio buffer
00120  *
00121  * param aFrameIdx frame index
00122  * return a TPtr8 reference to the requested frame
00123  */
00124         TPtr8& CAudioStreamEngine::GetFrame(TUint aFrameIdx);
00125 /*!
00126  * GetPlaybackFrames()
00127  *
00128  * discussion Returns a modifiable pointer to frames from the first frame to 
00129  * aLastFrame in the audio buffer
00130  *
00131  * param aLastFrame Index of the last frame to be included in the pointer returned
00132  * return a TPtr8 reference to the requested frames
00133  */
00134         TPtr8& CAudioStreamEngine::GetPlaybackFrames(TUint aLastFrame);
00135 
00136 /*!
00137  * ShowMessage()
00138  *
00139  * discussion Displays application messages for user on a label
00140  *
00141  * param aMsg text to be displayed
00142  * param aReset if true, the label will be cleared before displaying aMsg,
00143  *    if false, aMsg text will be appended to existing message on label
00144  */
00145         void ShowMessage(const TDesC& /* aMsg */, TBool /* aReset=false */);
00146         
00147 /*!
00148  * MaiscOpenComplete()
00149  *
00150  * discussion A callback function that is called when 
00151  *    CMdaAudioInputStream::Open() has completed, indicating that the audio 
00152  *    input stream is ready for use.
00153  *
00154  * param aError KErrNone if the open succeeded, otherwise one of the system 
00155  *    error codes.
00156  */
00157         virtual void MaiscOpenComplete(TInt aError);
00158 /*!
00159  * MaiscBufferCopied()
00160  *
00161  * discussion A callback function that is called when a chunk of audio data 
00162  *    has been copied to the descriptor specified in a 
00163  *    CMdaAudioInputStream::ReadL().
00164  *
00165  * param aError KErrNone if the copy succeeded, KErrAbort if the input stream
00166  *    was closed for some reason, otherwise one of the system error codes.
00167  */
00168         virtual void MaiscBufferCopied(TInt aError, const TDesC8& aBuffer);
00169 /*!
00170  * MaiscRecordComplete()
00171  *
00172  * discussion A callback function that is called when the input stream is
00173  *    closed using CMdaAudioInputStream::Stop(). 
00174  *
00175  * param aError KErrNone if the stop succeeded, otherwise one of the system
00176  *    error codes.
00177  */     
00178         virtual void MaiscRecordComplete(TInt aError);
00179 
00180 /*!
00181  * MaoscOpenComplete()
00182  *
00183  * discussion A callback function that is called when 
00184  *    CMdaAudioOutputStream::Open() has completed, indicating that the audio 
00185  *    output stream is ready for use.
00186  *
00187  * param aError KErrNone if the open succeeded, otherwise one of the system 
00188  *    error codes.
00189  */
00190         virtual void MaoscOpenComplete(TInt aError);
00191 /*!
00192  * MaoscBufferCopied()
00193  *
00194  * discussion A callback function that is called when a descriptor has been 
00195  *    copied to the lower layers of MMF. It is also called when an error has 
00196  *    occurred or when the client has stopped the stream playing before the 
00197  *    descriptor has been fully copied (by calling 
00198  *    CMdaAudioOutputStream::Stop())
00199  *
00200  * param aError KErrNone if the copy succeeded, otherwise one of the system
00201  *    error codes. KErrAbort indicates that the client has stopped the stream
00202  *    playing before the descriptor has been copied.
00203  * param aBuffer reference to the buffer that has been copied.
00204  */
00205         virtual void MaoscBufferCopied(TInt aError, const TDesC8& aBuffer);
00206         
00207 /*!
00208  * MaoscPlayComplete()
00209  *
00210  * discussion A callback function that is called when playback terminates as
00211  *    a result of a CMdaAudioOutputStream::Stop().
00212  *
00213  * param aError KErrNone if the close succeeded, otherwise one of the system
00214  *    error codes.
00215  */
00216         virtual void MaoscPlayComplete(TInt aError);
00217 
00218 public: // Functions from base classes
00219 
00220 private: // Basic two-phase EPOC constructors
00221 
00222 /*!
00223  * ConstructL()
00224  *
00225  * discussion Perform the second phase construction of a CAudioStreamEngine 
00226  *    object
00227  */
00228     void ConstructL();
00229  
00230 /*!
00231  * CAudioStreamEngine()
00232  *
00233  * discussion Perform the first phase of two phase construction 
00234  */
00235     CAudioStreamEngine(CAudioStreamAppUi* /* aAppUi */);
00236 
00237 private:        
00238 
00239         // enumeration of input/output stream status
00240         enum TStatus
00241                 {
00242                 ENotReady,
00243                 EOpen
00244                 };
00245 
00246                 
00247 private:        // data members
00248 
00249         // application UI object reference
00250         CAudioStreamAppUi* iAppUi;
00251         // audio input stream object reference
00252         CMdaAudioInputStream* iInputStream;
00253         // audio output stream object reference
00254         CMdaAudioOutputStream* iOutputStream;
00255 
00256         // Handle to CCoeEnv's file server
00257         RFs iFs;
00258 
00259         // Do we use AMR-NB encoding?
00260         TBool iUseAMR;
00261         // The path to the sample audio file (sample.aud or sample.amr)
00262         TFileName iAudioFilePath;
00263         // The audio file to be used (sample.aud or sample.amr)
00264         TFileName iAudioFile;   
00265         // The frame size for the current encoding
00266         TUint iFrameSize;
00267         // The number of frames to be buffered
00268         TUint iFrameCount;
00269 
00270         // A buffer containing the audio frames
00271         HBufC8* iStreamBuffer;  
00272         // Modifiable pointer used to reference a single frame in iStreamBuffer 
00273         // while recording, and all the valid frames in iStreamBuffer while playback (the
00274         // iStreamBuffer might not always be fully recorded in this example).
00275         TPtr8 iFramePtr;
00276         // Buffer status (does it contain valid audio data)
00277         TBool iBufferOK;
00278         // The default encoding used by the platform
00279         TFourCC iDefaultEncoding;
00280         // The encoding we are currently using
00281         TFourCC iCurrentEncoding;
00282 
00283         // Audio data stream settings for input and output streams
00284         TMdaAudioDataSettings iStreamSettings;
00285         // Status enumeration of input stream
00286         TStatus iInputStatus;
00287         // Status enumeration of output stream  
00288         TStatus iOutputStatus;
00289         // Index of audio data block currently being played/recorded on the buffer
00290         TUint iStreamIdx;
00291         // Application status message displayed to user
00292         TBuf<255> iMsg;
00293         // Stream start (first audio block in buffer) and end index
00294         TUint iStreamStart;
00295         TUint iStreamEnd;
00296         
00297 };
00298 
00299 #endif // AUDIOSTREAMENGINE_H
00300
